item.title: CoinFac announces quantum computing technology for cryptocurrency mining
item.description:
CoinFac announces quantum computing technology for cryptocurrency mining

According to recent reports, CoinFac, a technology company established this year, has just introduced a next generation quantum computing tech, meant for digital currency mining. In return, this will supposedly allow bitcoin and altcoin miners from all around the world to get a 4,000x speed increase.

item.title: Bitbank Seeks $1.57M to Build Bitcoin Mining Facility with 'world's only 12nm miners'
item.description:
Bitbank Seeks $1.57M to Build Bitcoin Mining Facility with 'world's only 12nm miners'

Shenzhen-based Bitbank Group, a bitcoin hardware manufacturer and digital currency software solutions provider, is looking to raise 3500 BTC ($1.57 million) via crowdfunding for its new mining facility in Xinjiang. The crowdfunding page states that the new mining facility will use the "world's only 12nm miners" to produce about 30 petahash of bitcoin mining power.

item.title: Switzerland to accept Bitcoin for Public Services | HolyTransaction
item.description:
Switzerland to accept Bitcoin for Public Services | HolyTransaction

Zug, city ubicated in Switzerland, announced it will accept bitcoin payments for public services. This is a pilot project to test the efficiency of the digital currency. This test will start on July 1st and will continue for the whole year.

item.title: Isle of Man bitcoin exchange CoinCorner obtains Designated Business Status
item.description:
Isle of Man bitcoin exchange CoinCorner obtains Designated Business Status

Bitcoin exchange CoinCorner announced last week it has achieved a Designated Business Status in the cryptocurrency-friendly Isle of Man, where the exchange is based. The Isle of Man Financial Servi...

item.title: Bitcoin Market OpenBazaar Unveils Plans for Tor Support, Mobile App - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Market OpenBazaar Unveils Plans for Tor Support, Mobile App - CoinDesk

The distributed bitcoin-powered marketplace app OpenBazaar has published a long-term roadmap in a bid to become a global leader in censorship-resistant trade. Since launch, OpenBazaar has seen a wide variety of vendors sign up to sell goods including caramel waffles, chili peppers and cannabis seeds.

item.title: Norway Authorities Nab 15 Drug Dealers In Silk Road '2.0' Operation
item.description:
Norway Authorities Nab 15 Drug Dealers In Silk Road '2.0' Operation

Norway police made their largest drug bust ever last month when they arrested 15 people selling drugs on what they claim is the second version of the notorious Silk Road online marketplace that the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation closed in 2013, according to the The Local Europe AB, a Swedish news source.

item.title: Cryptocurrency Company DNotes Launches Kickstarter Campaign
item.description:
Cryptocurrency Company DNotes Launches Kickstarter Campaign

Press Release: DNotes co-founder, highly regarded visionary and early Cryptocurrency adopter Alan Yong shares his experiences and lessons from over 4 decades of entrepreneurship in his new book "The Four Pillars of Business Success". DNotes is now launching a Kickstarter campaign as they continue celebrating 'Small Business Week' .

item.title: Why CME, ICE Pricing Data Are About to Boost Bitcoin
item.description:
Why CME, ICE Pricing Data Are About to Boost Bitcoin

Mainstream exchange embrace of Bitcoin could lead to less volatility and further acceptance and new opportunities. In what can be seen as a mainstream financial world's embrace of Bitcoin, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) and Intercontinental Exchange Inc. (ICE) are all set to publish data on prices of Bitcoin.

item.title: In search of Satoshi Nakamoto, Bitcoin's mysterious creator
item.description:
In search of Satoshi Nakamoto, Bitcoin's mysterious creator

The English-speaking world has long had a love affair with literature that attempts to describe experience from the point of view of another species. Henry Williamson is perhaps the best-known British chronicler of the beast's inner world: his early forays, particularly Tarka the Otter (1927) and Salar the Salmon (1935), are considered classics of the genre.

item.title: Does the Lightning Network Threaten Bitcoin's Censorship Resistance?
item.description:
Does the Lightning Network Threaten Bitcoin's Censorship Resistance?

The Lightning Network may well be Bitcoin's primary solution to the issue of scalability, but many skeptics believe there are unresolved issues with this layer-2 system for the blockchain. The possibility of too much centralization via so-called "supernodes" is one of the common criticisms of the Lightning Network, and attached to that is the fear of these new, mostly -centralized payment hubs having the capacity to censor transactions.
